69  @Category(LargeTests.class)
70  public class TestDistributedLogSplitting {
71    private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(TestSplitLogManager.class);
72    static {
73      Logger.getLogger("org.apache.hadoop.hbase").setLevel(Level.DEBUG);
74    }
75  
76    // Start a cluster with 2 masters and 3 regionservers
77    final int NUM_MASTERS = 2;
78    final int NUM_RS = 6;
79  
80    MiniHBaseCluster cluster;
81    HMaster master;
82    Configuration conf;
83    HBaseTestingUtility TEST_UTIL;
84  
85    private void startCluster(int num_rs) throws Exception{
86      ZKSplitLog.Counters.resetCounters();
87      LOG.info("Starting cluster");
88      conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
89      conf.getLong("hbase.splitlog.max.resubmit", 0);
90      // Make the failure test faster
91      conf.setInt("zookeeper.recovery.retry", 0);
92      TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtility(conf);
93      TEST_UTIL.startMiniCluster(NUM_MASTERS, num_rs);
94      cluster = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster();
95      LOG.info("Waiting for active/ready master");
96      cluster.waitForActiveAndReadyMaster();
97      master = cluster.getMaster();
98      while (cluster.getLiveRegionServerThreads().size() < num_rs) {
99        Threads.sleep(1);
100     }
101   }
102 
103   @After
104   public void after() throws Exception {
105     TEST_UTIL.shutdownMiniCluster();
106   }
107 
108   @Test (timeout=300000)
109   public void testThreeRSAbort() throws Exception {
110     LOG.info("testThreeRSAbort");
111     final int NUM_REGIONS_TO_CREATE = 40;
112     final int NUM_ROWS_PER_REGION = 100;
113 
114     startCluster(NUM_RS); // NUM_RS=6.
115 
116     ZooKeeperWatcher zkw = new ZooKeeperWatcher(conf,
117         "distributed log splitting test", null);
118 
119     HTable ht = installTable(zkw, "table", "family", NUM_REGIONS_TO_CREATE);
120     populateDataInTable(NUM_ROWS_PER_REGION, "family");
121 
122 
123     List<RegionServerThread> rsts = cluster.getLiveRegionServerThreads();
124     assertEquals(NUM_RS, rsts.size());
125     rsts.get(0).getRegionServer().abort("testing");
126     rsts.get(1).getRegionServer().abort("testing");
127     rsts.get(2).getRegionServer().abort("testing");
128 
129     long start = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
130     while (cluster.getLiveRegionServerThreads().size() > (NUM_RS - 3)) {
131       if (EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - start > 60000) {
132         assertTrue(false);
133       }
134       Thread.sleep(200);
135     }
136 
137     start = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
138     while (getAllOnlineRegions(cluster).size() < (NUM_REGIONS_TO_CREATE + 2)) {
139       if (EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - start > 60000) {
140         assertTrue(false);
141       }
142       Thread.sleep(200);
143     }
144 
145     assertEquals(NUM_REGIONS_TO_CREATE * NUM_ROWS_PER_REGION,
146         TEST_UTIL.countRows(ht));
147     ht.close();
148   }
149 
150   @Test (timeout=300000)
151   public void testRecoveredEdits() throws Exception {
152     LOG.info("testRecoveredEdits");
153     startCluster(NUM_RS);
154     final int NUM_LOG_LINES = 1000;
155     final SplitLogManager slm = master.getMasterFileSystem().splitLogManager;
156     // turn off load balancing to prevent regions from moving around otherwise
157     // they will consume recovered.edits
158     master.balanceSwitch(false);
159     FileSystem fs = master.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
160 
161     List<RegionServerThread> rsts = cluster.getLiveRegionServerThreads();
162     
163     Path rootdir = FSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
164 
165     installTable(new ZooKeeperWatcher(conf, "table-creation", null),
166         "table", "family", 40);
167     byte[] table = Bytes.toBytes("table");
168     List<HRegionInfo> regions = null;
169     HRegionServer hrs = null;
170     for (int i = 0; i < NUM_RS; i++) {
171       hrs = rsts.get(i).getRegionServer();
172       regions = hrs.getOnlineRegions();
173       if (regions.size() != 0) break;
174     }
175     final Path logDir = new Path(rootdir, HLog.getHLogDirectoryName(hrs
176         .getServerName().toString()));
177     
178     LOG.info("#regions = " + regions.size());
179     Iterator<HRegionInfo> it = regions.iterator();
180     while (it.hasNext()) {
181       HRegionInfo region = it.next();
182       if (region.isMetaTable()) {
183         it.remove();
184       }
185     }
186     makeHLog(hrs.getWAL(), regions, "table",
187         NUM_LOG_LINES, 100);
188 
189     slm.splitLogDistributed(logDir);
190 
191     int count = 0;
192     for (HRegionInfo hri : regions) {
193 
194       Path tdir = HTableDescriptor.getTableDir(rootdir, table);
195       @SuppressWarnings("deprecation")
196       Path editsdir =
197         HLog.getRegionDirRecoveredEditsDir(HRegion.getRegionDir(tdir,
198         hri.getEncodedName()));
199       LOG.debug("checking edits dir " + editsdir);
200       FileStatus[] files = fs.listStatus(editsdir);
201       assertEquals(1, files.length);
202       int c = countHLog(files[0].getPath(), fs, conf);
203       count += c;
204       LOG.info(c + " edits in " + files[0].getPath());
205     }
206     assertEquals(NUM_LOG_LINES, count);
207   }
208 
209   /**
210    * The original intention of this test was to force an abort of a region
211    * server and to make sure that the failure path in the region servers is
212    * properly evaluated. But it is difficult to ensure that the region server
213    * doesn't finish the log splitting before it aborts. Also now, there is
214    * this code path where the master will preempt the region server when master
215    * detects that the region server has aborted.
216    * @throws Exception
217    */
218   @Test (timeout=300000)
219   public void testWorkerAbort() throws Exception {
220     LOG.info("testWorkerAbort");
221     startCluster(1);
222     final int NUM_LOG_LINES = 10000;
223     final SplitLogManager slm = master.getMasterFileSystem().splitLogManager;
224     FileSystem fs = master.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
225 
226     final List<RegionServerThread> rsts = cluster.getLiveRegionServerThreads();
227     HRegionServer hrs = rsts.get(0).getRegionServer();
228     Path rootdir = FSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
229     final Path logDir = new Path(rootdir,
230         HLog.getHLogDirectoryName(hrs.getServerName().toString()));
231 
232     installTable(new ZooKeeperWatcher(conf, "table-creation", null),
233         "table", "family", 40);
234     makeHLog(hrs.getWAL(), hrs.getOnlineRegions(), "table",
235         NUM_LOG_LINES, 100);
236 
237     new Thread() {
238       public void run() {
239         waitForCounter(tot_wkr_task_acquired, 0, 1, 1000);
240         for (RegionServerThread rst : rsts) {
241           rst.getRegionServer().abort("testing");
242         }
243       }
244     }.start();
245     // slm.splitLogDistributed(logDir);
246     FileStatus[] logfiles = fs.listStatus(logDir);
247     TaskBatch batch = new TaskBatch();
248     slm.enqueueSplitTask(logfiles[0].getPath().toString(), batch);
249     //waitForCounter but for one of the 2 counters
250     long curt = System.currentTimeMillis();
251     long waitTime = 80000;
252     long endt = curt + waitTime;
253     while (curt < endt) {
254       if ((tot_wkr_task_resigned.get() + tot_wkr_task_err.get() + 
255           tot_wkr_final_transistion_failed.get() + tot_wkr_task_done.get() +
256           tot_wkr_preempt_task.get()) == 0) {
257         Thread.yield();
258         curt = System.currentTimeMillis();
259       } else {
260         assertEquals(1, (tot_wkr_task_resigned.get() + tot_wkr_task_err.get() + 
261             tot_wkr_final_transistion_failed.get() + tot_wkr_task_done.get() +
262             tot_wkr_preempt_task.get()));
263         return;
264       }
265     }
266     fail("none of the following counters went up in " + waitTime + 
267         " milliseconds - " +
268         "tot_wkr_task_resigned, tot_wkr_task_err, " +
269         "tot_wkr_final_transistion_failed, tot_wkr_task_done, " +
270         "tot_wkr_preempt_task");
271   }
272 
273   @Test(timeout=30000)
274   public void testDelayedDeleteOnFailure() throws Exception {
275     LOG.info("testDelayedDeleteOnFailure");
276     startCluster(1);
277     final SplitLogManager slm = master.getMasterFileSystem().splitLogManager;
278     final FileSystem fs = master.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
279     final Path logDir = new Path(FSUtils.getRootDir(conf), "x");
280     fs.mkdirs(logDir);
281     ExecutorService executor = null;
282     try {
283       final Path corruptedLogFile = new Path(logDir, "x");
284       FSDataOutputStream out;
285       out = fs.create(corruptedLogFile);
286       out.write(0);
287       out.write(Bytes.toBytes("corrupted bytes"));
288       out.close();
289       slm.ignoreZKDeleteForTesting = true;
290       executor = Executors.newSingleThreadExecutor();
291       Runnable runnable = new Runnable() {
292        @Override
293        public void run() {
294           try {
295             // since the logDir is a fake, corrupted one, so the split log worker
296             // will finish it quickly with error, and this call will fail and throw
297             // an IOException.
298             slm.splitLogDistributed(logDir);
299           } catch (IOException ioe) {
300             try {
301               assertTrue(fs.exists(corruptedLogFile));
302               // this call will block waiting for the task to be removed from the
303               // tasks map which is not going to happen since ignoreZKDeleteForTesting
304               // is set to true, until it is interrupted.
305               slm.splitLogDistributed(logDir);
306             } catch (IOException e) {
307               assertTrue(Thread.currentThread().isInterrupted());
308               return;
309             }
310             fail("did not get the expected IOException from the 2nd call");
311           }
312           fail("did not get the expected IOException from the 1st call");
313         }
314       };
315       Future<?> result = executor.submit(runnable);
316       try {
317         result.get(2000, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
318       } catch (TimeoutException te) {
319         // it is ok, expected.
320       }
321       waitForCounter(tot_mgr_wait_for_zk_delete, 0, 1, 10000);
322       executor.shutdownNow();
323       executor = null;
324 
325       // make sure the runnable is finished with no exception thrown.
326       result.get();
327     } finally {
328       if (executor != null) {
329         // interrupt the thread in case the test fails in the middle.
330         // it has no effect if the thread is already terminated.
331         executor.shutdownNow();
332       }
333       fs.delete(logDir, true);
334     }
335   }
336 
337   HTable installTable(ZooKeeperWatcher zkw, String tname, String fname,
338       int nrs ) throws Exception {
339     // Create a table with regions
340     byte [] table = Bytes.toBytes(tname);
341     byte [] family = Bytes.toBytes(fname);
342     LOG.info("Creating table with " + nrs + " regions");
343     HTable ht = TEST_UTIL.createTable(table, family);
344     int numRegions = TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegions(conf, ht, family, nrs);
345     assertEquals(nrs, numRegions);
346       LOG.info("Waiting for no more RIT\n");
347     blockUntilNoRIT(zkw, master);
348     // disable-enable cycle to get rid of table's dead regions left behind
349     // by createMultiRegions
350     LOG.debug("Disabling table\n");
351     TEST_UTIL.getHBaseAdmin().disableTable(table);
352     LOG.debug("Waiting for no more RIT\n");
353     blockUntilNoRIT(zkw, master);
354     NavigableSet<String> regions = getAllOnlineRegions(cluster);
355     LOG.debug("Verifying only catalog regions are assigned\n");
356     if (regions.size() != 2) {
357       for (String oregion : regions)
358         LOG.debug("Region still online: " + oregion);
359     }
360     assertEquals(2, regions.size());
361     LOG.debug("Enabling table\n");
362     TEST_UTIL.getHBaseAdmin().enableTable(table);
363     LOG.debug("Waiting for no more RIT\n");
364     blockUntilNoRIT(zkw, master);
365     LOG.debug("Verifying there are " + numRegions + " assigned on cluster\n");
366     regions = getAllOnlineRegions(cluster);
367     assertEquals(numRegions + 2, regions.size());
368     return ht;
369   }
370 
371   void populateDataInTable(int nrows, String fname) throws Exception {
372     byte [] family = Bytes.toBytes(fname);
373 
374     List<RegionServerThread> rsts = cluster.getLiveRegionServerThreads();
375     assertEquals(NUM_RS, rsts.size());
376 
377     for (RegionServerThread rst : rsts) {
378       HRegionServer hrs = rst.getRegionServer();
379       List<HRegionInfo> hris = hrs.getOnlineRegions();
380       for (HRegionInfo hri : hris) {
381         if (hri.isMetaTable()) {
382           continue;
383         }
384         LOG.debug("adding data to rs = " + rst.getName() +
385             " region = "+ hri.getRegionNameAsString());
386         HRegion region = hrs.getOnlineRegion(hri.getRegionName());
387         assertTrue(region != null);
388         putData(region, hri.getStartKey(), nrows, Bytes.toBytes("q"), family);
389       }
390     }
391   }
392 
393   public void makeHLog(HLog log,
394       List<HRegionInfo> hris, String tname,
395       int num_edits, int edit_size) throws IOException {
396 
397     byte[] table = Bytes.toBytes(tname);
398     HTableDescriptor htd = new HTableDescriptor(tname);
399     byte[] value = new byte[edit_size];
400     for (int i = 0; i < edit_size; i++) {
401       value[i] = (byte)('a' + (i % 26));
402     }
403     int n = hris.size();
404     int[] counts = new int[n];
405     int j = 0;
406     if (n > 0) {
407       for (int i = 0; i < num_edits; i += 1) {
408         WALEdit e = new WALEdit();
409         byte [] row = Bytes.toBytes("r" + Integer.toString(i));
410         byte [] family = Bytes.toBytes("f");
411         byte [] qualifier = Bytes.toBytes("c" + Integer.toString(i));
412         e.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qualifier,
413             System.currentTimeMillis(), value));
414         j++;
415         log.append(hris.get(j % n), table, e, System.currentTimeMillis(), htd);
416         counts[j % n] += 1;
417       }
418     }
419     log.sync();
420     log.close();
421     for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
422       LOG.info("region " + hris.get(i).getRegionNameAsString() +
423           " has " + counts[i] + " edits");
424     }
425     return;
426   }
427 
428   private int countHLog(Path log, FileSystem fs, Configuration conf)
429   throws IOException {
430     int count = 0;
431     HLog.Reader in = HLog.getReader(fs, log, conf);
432     while (in.next() != null) {
433       count++;
434     }
435     return count;
436   }
437 
438   private void blockUntilNoRIT(ZooKeeperWatcher zkw, HMaster master)
439   throws KeeperException, InterruptedException {
440     ZKAssign.blockUntilNoRIT(zkw);
441     master.assignmentManager.waitUntilNoRegionsInTransition(60000);
442   }
443 
444   private void putData(HRegion region, byte[] startRow, int numRows, byte [] qf,
445       byte [] ...families)
446   throws IOException {
447     for(int i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {
448       Put put = new Put(Bytes.add(startRow, Bytes.toBytes(i)));
449       for(byte [] family : families) {
450         put.add(family, qf, null);
451       }
452       region.put(put);
453     }
454   }
455 
456   private NavigableSet<String> getAllOnlineRegions(MiniHBaseCluster cluster)
457       throws IOException {
458     NavigableSet<String> online = new TreeSet<String>();
459     for (RegionServerThread rst : cluster.getLiveRegionServerThreads()) {
460       for (HRegionInfo region : rst.getRegionServer().getOnlineRegions()) {
461         online.add(region.getRegionNameAsString());
462       }
463     }
464     return online;
465   }
466 
467   private void waitForCounter(AtomicLong ctr, long oldval, long newval,
468       long timems) {
469     long curt = System.currentTimeMillis();
470     long endt = curt + timems;
471     while (curt < endt) {
472       if (ctr.get() == oldval) {
473         Thread.yield();
474         curt = System.currentTimeMillis();
475       } else {
476         assertEquals(newval, ctr.get());
477         return;
478       }
479     }
480     assertTrue(false);
481   }

485     new org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ResourceCheckerJUnitRule();
